bow: my kid is not like the others for the first time took our 18 month old daughter to tiny tots reading and song group at the library for kids between and thought that it would be good for her to get socialized as sahm and do have friends with kids her age what mess while the other children sat quietly with their parents my child was screaming running going up to everyone laughing like maniac taking the storytellers things etc she had literally no boundaries and was so full of energy call her over and she would even look at me she was so excited to be with other kids but when they would pay attention she go off by herself and play with what ever she could get her hands on proud that she does have fear and that she interested in the world around her but worried because she was doing what the other kids were doing staying by their parent and paying attention to the story worse yet one mother kept giving me the evil eye and then took her kids and left mid story it was obviously my kid that bothered her do know what to think about this help do you ever read to your daughter if not you might want to just to give her sense of how to behave during that type of activity you may also want to explore more physically active social venue for her to adjust to other children perhaps mommy and me swim class my son did the same thing the first time we took him it gets easier oh thank you was debating if we should keep going do read with her but not to her she sits on my lap and we hold the book together she and point to things and say what they are perhaps can try to do like they do in the class where hold the book and tell her the story new to this area and am actively seeking play group for her to get her more familiar to being around others her age swim class is out because also have month old and no childcare yea we are in pretty much the same boat it took few times going but the more they get comfortable with it the more they calm down did you get the stink eye from any of the other parents totally did the storyteller was really kind and patient which was reassuring us too think it learned skill and the more practice she gets as well as the more she notices the other kids behavior the longer she ll participate when we started going to storytime my son would last maybe minutes year later he sits for about 20 with the help of snacks we actually started with small playgroup so it started with 10 minutes play then storytime and music time and the group consisted of only about other adults they were all understanding luckily did you try to keep him with you at first or did you let him do his own thing until he came around tried to keep brooke with me at times and she was having it the one parent who left made me feel like total shit it group of year olds surely she had to expect that there would be some running around honestly might have given you little bit of stink eye myself in the story times ve been to they made it really clear at the beginning that if your child is being disruptive or needs break to please take them out if the room and return when they are ready ve had to take my son out and while it is no fun it does teach him the limits of what he can do during story time and prevents him from being the model of bad behavior for other kids agree though that it it is great that you daughter is afraid and is interested in life maybe she just needs some time and guidance and she ll settle in yea my son loves books so its never very hard for storytime anymore they did give any instruction on taking rowdy kids out it year olds though older kids have their own groups perhaps those groups have stricter guidelines yea that kinds fail but do let them discourage you she should ve known that kids that age are all going to sit quietly so easily maybe she had migraine and just struggled with any sensory input or maybe that parent is like me and add am ridiculously easily distracted and could see someone thinking was giving them the stink eye over playful kid when really was just being distracted by them and frustrated with my own inability to focus all while understanding that it is normal for yr old to run around during story time anyhoo just try not to focus on the stink eye even if that is what she meant her expectations were not reasonable take your daughter out it good for both of you maybe try running off some of her energy before you bring her to the next story time take her to park or indoor play area where she can bounce off the walls for bit know it hard at such young age but explain to her ahead of time what your expectations are when you re at story time you ll sit in mommy lap and we ll listen to the story we ll be quiet and keep our hands to ourselves we ll have time to get up and run around after the story over you could also try bringing quiet toy or two to distract her with if she starts disturbing others and you may just have to be prepared to remove her from the situation if she gets too wild my daughter lot like yours so when she was younger frequently have to remove her from room for few minutes until she settled down again thanks that perspective that had not considered really want brooke to learn and to get some social experience which is why we are going hope that brooke behavior will improve over time unfortunately the room was filled with awesome toys which only fueled her excitement the play thing before is really good idea thank you ll try that deleted thank you that is very reassuring am looking for play group for her we just moved to this town so it been tough getting settled in and finding the right activities for her in that case you could also try bringing her to the story room 30 minutes early so she have plenty of time to get the awesome toys out of her system first thought about that but wonder if that would give her mixed message about what is supposed to happen in that room on one hand she get to do everything and get it out of her system but on the other hand she might think that she supposed to play in there just do know toddler logic is there any lol at 18 months she old enough to understand quite bit bet if you told her we re going to have some time to play with the toys now but in little while when the story starts we ll need to sit down and listen she be able to process that whether or not she has the self control to do it is another question entirely but would worry about her understanding being the main issue like everything in life this stuff takes practice once it not so new she ll settle in and realize that the other kids are listening to the story you need to keep going though because you need friends with kids she needs to practice her social skills which are really problem solving skills regularly it will get easier once she learns what expected of her *hugs* kids are easy and wish to bob sometimes they came with instruction manuals lol thank you hope so we re going to stay the course and going to practice reading to her the way that they do in storytime to help introduce her to the idea do get that she understands that much detail from me she understands basic stuff like me asking her to do something that she familiar with like find your cup take this to daddy and the like but she does seem to understand me explaining things that will take place in the future thank you raising kids is tough every time we hit bump or awkward moment try to remember how fast they grow up and to cherish this time even if it tough there are days when *wish* so much could go back to the baby toddler days because it was just so much easier to figure out what he wanted what he needed what was pissing him off etc these days it lot harder and he ca always control his meltdowns just have to remember that it not his fault he did ask for this and neither did hubby and it just happened having massive meltdown is just how he reacts when things do go the way he expects them to and he ca really help it you know why your kid was not like the others because the rest of us with kids like yours learned similar hard lesson and stay away from story time tried taking my son to an organized story time for the first time around that same age thought it would be lovely calm way to get out of the house with him and his newborn brother oh my god the story time was held in local historic home and some brainiac decided the best room was the one with glass case of fine china everybody else kids ranging from 11 months to sat nicely and listened while my kid was crawling along the empty bottom shelf of the china display giggling hysterically at my attempts to grab him while trying to keep my nursing week old from falling out of the wrap another mother with an older kid took pity on me and helped me coax him out and then moved her chair to block access to the case the docent kept trying to get his attention by asking him come up and point out pictures in the book to no avail during the song and dance at the end he stood in the middle of the room giving everyone wtf is wrong with you people look until he decided he was done half way through the song and threw tantrum when kept him from leaving did take him to another story time until just recently at 33 months he can now sit for at least one short book usually but does not understand why on earth anyone would stand up and sing and dance at the end and he still gets really upset if he wants to leave and anyone tries to stop him he is just very active energetic kid when he is doing something physical like playing game with his friends that involves running or climbing or jumping he has wonderful long attention span and can follow rules but sitting still and listening is just not his thing we re still trying since we found story time in much more active kid friendly setting that is lead by certified preschool teachers but still do expect him to sit through the whole thing for quite some time if you want more socialization for both of you recommend finding moms group that meets at local parks instead of structured quiet activity have been going to the same one for year now and both my sons and have made some really great friends and at least twice week he gets to go to different park and let out all of his wild energy with kids who can keep up with him give her chance to understand bet she ll surprise you almost evey child is like this in their first times am sahp mother too and my daughter is and few months ago we started going to play group every wednesdays she runs around takes toys away from other kids doesnt stay in the circle for story time it is normal it lot to get used to but it gets easier you just have to be patient follow her keep quiet and calm and explain very simply that what she is doing is wrong right now can recommend two book recently bought and am loving them how to talk to kids so they listen and listen so kids will talk and the pocket parent ignore the evil eye from other parents every child is different thank you so much however ca help but to be worried now as her mom want her to enjoy herself but also want her to be able to do what her peers can do seeing her not be able to sit down and pay attention made me feel like failed her like should have taught her something that did not keep going some kids are just little crazier then others and that totally fine do pay attention to that other parent who gave you dirty looks take pride in the fact that your lo does conform that being said you might want to spend the morning at play gym or playground running her about and see if that helps also lot of the story times allow parents to give their kids food drink as long as it quiet and the kids stay sitting with it might be worth try if your lo will sit still for snack gt want her to enjoy herself but also want her to be able to do what her peers can do seeing her not be able to sit down and pay attention made me feel like failed her do usually comment in this sub because do have kids yet but as an adult who was exactly like your daughter is at that age you have not failed her and do be comparing her to her peers too much especially at that age some kids can sit quietly and listen seemingly without having to learn but some kids do learn to do that until well older myself did really get good at it until 9+ and even then had to doodle constantly to stay focused on the lessons in school do think of her peers as the other kids in the story group as cochineal said there literally is natural selection process happening at those kinds of places kids that just ca handle it are taken back and the parents of kids who are good in that environment bring them more often would never have been able to do or *enjoy* quiet story group as kid but excelled in hands on learning and was very smart when able to use more of my senses while absorbing information went to couple of science day camps as child and was top of the class in the lessons disguised as games because the learning involved getting up and doing things and was quite popular with the other kids if may say so it sounds like your daughter would do great at montessori school when she gets older is there local organization that does kids swimming lessons near you that good physically oriented social activity that even babies can handle and she ll get to socialize with kids like her active and energetic while you can shoot the breeze with parents who share your struggles that worked wonders for my mother when was small some kids just are the reading group type my daughter was also the terror of story time mommy and me ballet and music together the only place that was real problem was ballet and the teachers asked us to drop out would give her some free play run around time before going into room arrive few minutes early and allow her to look around the room and go over some simple rules during story time would have her on my lap in the front of the room right in front of the person reading the story so she would be distracted if the place allowed snack give her little something she could feed herself so her hands had something to do sometimes it worked out and sometimes we would leave if she was distracting to others we also had loads of play dates with children her age which she loved join local mom group or meet some parents at parks and set up some playtime my daughter is now in kindergarten and sits well through instruction and is one of those disruptive kids anymore before and after school we have lot of free play time since she is still energetic ve resisted signing up for classes after school because know with her personality she needs some freedom know it tough to get the stink eye from other parents but absolutely love my daughter free spirit she is creative and funny and great girl to hang out with chin up you are doing great job would consider starting with social activity that is more play based like gymboree just discovered our local continuing education center offers free classes for sahps and their kids one of the most popular classes is outdoor classroom where you meet at park and an instructor provides toys and music and parachute play time etc much like you pay for in an expensive gymboree class but outdoors and free through the city lol yup totally my daughter at least the couple of different story times at various libraries they are totally cool with this after couple times my daughter got into the groove of what the other kids are doing but this is totally ok well eyes just try to guide them to one of the tables in the back of the room with puzzles and table toys where they can quietly play that way they can still see the story and be involved from distance young dog to dog park they have no boundaries and have to learn them from older more experienced dogs and dog owners everyone goes through it and it does get easier some dog owners are bit more
